results.description:
Their major issue is that they have tons of donations, and not even close enough amount of volunteers, to sort useable vs. recycle goods.  

http://thewishproject.org/ 

The Wish Project is a non-profit dedicated to providing free furniture, home goods, baby goods, and clothing to people in need in the Merrimack Valley, primarily through reuse and recycling. They serve thousands of people each year, and rely on the help of many volunteers. Let's be some of those volunteers! We'll take on whatever task they need on this day, but generally it involves sorting and organizing donations so they can be given out to clients. Children ages 8+ are welcome to join the effort. It's a great opportunity to teach your kids compassion in a very hands-on way. 

IMPORTANT:

If you are bringing children, please make a note in the comments section so I can give the Wish Project an accurate count of adults and kids who will be attending.

http://thewishproject.org/

 *PLEASE NOTE:  When you RSVP 'yes' it becomes a commitment. I am in contact with the volunteer coordinator, Patty, whom is now a member, giving her a head count. She then creates a list of things that need to be done -relying upon the number of volunteers. If your plans change, please be considerate -take a moment to update your RSVP to 'no.' It's very simple- and greatly appreciated! Thanks :)

results.description:
• [Don't be concerned if you don't see many RSVPs here... our members tend to RSVP via our members site at WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org.]

Please arrive at 9:00 am. From 9 to 9:15 am, we set up the meeting and network. We start the meeting at 9:15 am, and continue until 10:45 am. When you enter Church of the Good Shepherd, walk downstairs and take a left. If you arrive late, just walk in and have a seat at any open spot.

Please visit "Meeting Roles & Responsibilities" for more information about what to expect from a club meeting.

Here's a sample agenda for our meeting:

9:00 AM Setting up/Networking

9:15 AM President's Greeting and Club announcements

Welcome all to the First Watertown Saturday club.

Toastmaster's Welcome 

Introduces each role, its purpose, and the person who will perform the role.

Humorist/Invocation

Starts the meeting on a light-hearted note.

Grammarian's Word of the Day

Encourages each of us to add a new word to our vocabularies. Challenge us to use the new word spontaneously.

Scheduled Speeches


Club members give the speeches that they've scheduled and prepared in advance using the guidelines from one of the Toastmasters International communication manuals.

Table Topics

Our meeting's Topicsmaster provides our members and guests with an opportunity for demonstrating and honing their skills for impromptu speaking.

General Evaluator's Introduction


Introduces evaluation team members and evaluate the evaluators and the meeting in general.

Speech Evaluations


Club members provide helpful, supportive feedback to each of the scheduled speaker in a positive and friendly manner.

Grammarian's Report

Grammarian reports on how many times speakers used the Word of the Day and how we used the English language.

Ah-Counter's Report

Ah-counter reports how many filler-words and false starts were used by each participant, to raise speakers' awareness of these instances and to encourage improvement.

Timer's Report

Timer reports speaking times of all major speaking roles to encourage members learn to accomplish tasks within set time limits.

General Evaluator's Report

General evaluator provides a review of the meeting, what went well, and areas for improvement to encourage continual growth and an optimal quality of our meetings.

Toastmaster's Closing Remarks 

10:45 AM President Adjourns Meeting

We usually have a convivial lunch at The Red Lentil. Hang around after the meeting for details.

WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org
results.how_to_find_us: Park on Russell Avenue and enter Church of the Good Shepherd from Russell Avenue. When you enter, walk downstairs and take a left.
results.name: Watertown Saturday Toastmasters club meeting

results.description:
Gloss-tah!!


Please note the change in start-time from 10:30 am to 9:30 am.  I changed the start-time so that we could take advantage of the sun and not have to end the trek close to sunset.

Please arrive by 9:15.  I'd like to start the trek at 9:30.

Join us on this 9 +/- mile loop for a moderate to fast-paced hike as we explore the main streets and back roads of East Gloucester.  We'll start from Rocky Neck, head northeast into East Gloucester, make our way south along the 'Back Shore', onto Eastern Point where we'll visit the Audubon Sanctuary and, weather permitting, take a walk to the end of Dog Bar Breakwater. 


Expect an accumulated elevation gain of 200' and an 'easy-ish' hike along paved sidewalks and roads, dirt paths, sandy and rocky beaches, and granite ledges.  As it's likely to be a bit chilly expect a fast-paced hike for a good portion of the route.  


Also, expect this trek to last 4+ hours.  Do not RSVP *Yes* if you need to be back to the parking lot by a certain time.  BSOT does not guarantee that we'll end our events by a specific time.  Plan your day accordingly. 


No dogs, no guests!


Driving Directions:


Route 128 North to Gloucester. Go through two rotaries, staying on 128. Then go straight, through two traffic lights, and up the hill onto East Main Street. Stay on East Main for about a mile, bearing right at the bottom of the hill, and follow East Main as it curves around the harbor. Turn right onto Rocky Neck Avenue and park in the public parking lot.

The municipal lot holds several dozen vehicles. Carpooling is always recommended for BSOT events.  If you wish to carpool you can announce that in the 'comments' section of this event.  To make carpool arrangements with another BSOT member click on that member's profile and email them directly via the Meetup Messenger service.  If you have the message feature turned off you won't be able to contact other members directly, nor will other members be able to contact you.

http://www.essexheritage.org/attractions/rocky-neck-art-colony

http://gloucester-ma.gov/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gloucester,_Massachusetts

http://www.massaudubon.org/

The Fine Print:

Duration: Approximately 4 hours. However, any time estimate given by an Event Organizer is just that. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the group itself. Don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day.

The Organizer is not responsible for getting you back in time. I will email all those who have RSVPd *yes* the day before the event with weather and condition updates. But, use your own judgment.

Anyone with recurrent "No Shows" or about whom we have received complaints from fellow hikers will not be accepted. If you haven't hiked with us before, add yourself to the list if you can adhere to these basic prerequisites.


Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. We are committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up.

This hike is rated Easy. You should be able to stay with the group. This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork.


We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy snow or extreme cold weather cancels. Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event. Your Event Organizers are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree (woof!).


If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below: Remember: Your Event Organizers are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason. If you want to carpool, put a message in the comment section. To respond, please send that person a direct message by clicking on their profile picture on the right.
results.name: The East Gloucester Trek

results.description:
"Ring in the New Year, and knock off your first resolution while you're at it."


If weeknights are difficult, take advantage of this Saturday meetup to build confident speaking skills. We'll show you a few secrets to defeat the anxiety we all feel in front of groups, and some tips to connect with your audience. [We'll be meeting most First Saturdays unless a holiday moves us to the preceding weekend].


Our Meetups are fast-paced and entertaining. Not intimidating. You are welcome to participate in our two-minute impromptu speaking exercises, but certainly not required. We have a 30-second “Round Robin” that everyone participates in (it’s fun and easy), and you’ll probably be asked to introduce yourself [talk briefly about an interest, or what brought you there]. Pretty basic, no surprises.  The only requirement is to enjoy yourself and get a sense of how the meetups run. [This session will supplement our usual Wed evening meeting, not replace it. Sessions start promptly, so please arrive a bit early.]  Please rsvp.

4th Floor, Room 011. You must take the elevator by the security desk to access the floor.

Parking: If you can't find street parking, there is parking to the rear of the bldg. You will present your ticket to the security desk on your way out ($3), then insert the ticket at the gate as you exit.
(Don't park in the supermarket/Porter Square shopping center parking lot.)


See the "About Us" tab for more info.


NOTE: For those who like to plan ahead, we'll be meeting the 2nd and 4th Wednesdays in January.  We'll hold a First Saturday session in February if the demand is there.
results.how_to_find_us: 4th Floor, Room 011. You must take the elevator by the security desk to access the floor.
results.name: 'First Saturday': Speak to Yr New Year's Resolution, 02 Jan, 9:45AM

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

results.description:
Every Saturday morning at 10:00 AM we gather for a fun, calming group run at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. Both walkers and runners are welcome. Our main goal is to socialize and support one another!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed. 

We meet twice weekly at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir (Cleveland Circle/Reservoir Green Line C or D train) -- on Saturday mornings at 10:00 AM and Thursday evenings at 6:30 PM. We first gather in front of the Cleveland Circle Starbucks, before heading over to the reservoir. See you there!

If you are interested in becoming a member or a volunteer, in making a contribution to the Club, in sponsoring a runner in recovery, or in learning more about the Boston Bulldog educational wellness/running program, contact us at:

results.description:
Fee: Free. An optional donation of $5 or more is suggested
Contact: [masked] for RSVP & address

Past event pictures: https://www.facebook.com/events/920337561388748/

Start your new year by participating in this mindful and special workshop. In the first 30 minutes of the workshop, Dr. Sung will lead participants to practice basic Tai Chi movements, with a focus on breathing and the balance of energy within the self and with the environment (moving meditation). In addition, Dr. Sung will lead participants to practice the calligraphy of ancient hieroglyphs or modern regular script styles (kai-shu). Individualized instructions will be provided based on each participant’s level of previous experience. For this workshop on January 2nd, you will have an opportunity to learn and create your own arts – by writing Chinese characters on a sheet of red paper (a Chinese New year tradition: Spring Festival Couplets), guided by Dr. Sung. Furthermore, participants are encouraged to bring their favorite words in English and learn their translations in Chinese characters. Participants will practice writing the characters on paper. Afterword, the best characters will be designated “your artwork of the day”. All will love the feel of each stroke and be amazed by power of each on as well as their meaning for the heart and for your well-being. Please come and learn this unique method of self-empowerment and healing in this creative and dynamic class. This workshop is appropriate for anyone age 10 and above. Children under 10 may be admitted with the instructor’s prior approval. - RSVP – ([masked])
Participants will receive hand written Chinese calligraphy. Dr. Sung will select a Chinese character or a word specifically for the participant (based on Dr. Sung’s observation and understanding of the participant) and write the word or phrase on a paper in the front the participant. This individualized and thoughtful calligraphy is the participant’s to keep. Dr. Sung will introduce some positive and spiritual words to welcome the New Year and Chinese New Year.

This event is sponsored by YUAN3 CHIH4 EDUCATION INC. (www.Yuan3Chih4Edu.org), a nonprofit organization promoting global education and health care resources sharing, and Tomoko’s Wednesday Dinner & Healing Arts [masked]). All donations go to YUAN3 CHIH4 EDUCATION, INC. to promote continuing community education and health care services.

Location: Central Sq., Cambridge, MA
*8-minute walk from Central Square Red Line T station
*Buses # 1, CT1, 47, 64, 68, 70, 70A, 83, and 91
Contact: [masked] for address
Parking: On-street parking along Broadway (meter enforced till 6 pm, please check the current regulations); Green St. garage available for those needing more than 2 hours. FREE PARKING ON SUNDAY ANYWHERE AS LONG AS IT IS A LEAGEL PARKING SPOT, NO PERMIT REQUIRED ON SUNDAY.
What to bring: comfortable clothes, your choice of art paper or sketchpad, and brushes, if you have them. *Traditional calligraphy paper, ink, ink sticks, stone stand, and brushes will be provided if needed. Dr. Yung-Chi Sung M.A., Ph.D.
Born in Taipei, Taiwan, Yung-Chi grew up in a family of teachers. His parents were both teachers. His father taught physics and his mother taught Chinese literature. This may explain how and why he developed a mind that simultaneously admired arts and appreciated the sciences. Dr. Sung has a B.S. in Psychology from Soochow University in Taipei, , an M.A. in Linguistics (with a minor in Cognitive Science), an M.A. in Educational Psychology (with a minor in Psychology), and a Ph.D. in Educational Psychology (with a concentration in Psychological Foundation, Learning, and Cognition, and a minor in Cognitive Science, Linguistics, Neuroscience, and Psychology). He was a research assistant at the Department of Psychology, National University, Taipei, Taiwan. In 1997 he went to University for graduate studies and was a research assistant and method/statistics consultant at University of Minnesota Medical School from 1998 to 2005. Within that period of time, he also served as the President and on the Board of Directors, was Chair of Education and Community Development Committee, Chair of Finance Operation Committee, and Chair of Policy Committee for Chateau Student Housing Cooperative, a not-for-profit co-op providing affordable housing for students from diverse backgrounds, including US and international students. He served as Assistant Director of Outcomes Assessment at University of Maryland University College (UMUC) at Adelphi, Maryland from 2005 to 2008, where for one year he also taught Tai-Chi for stress relief as a diversity initiative. From 2008 to 2014, he was the Director of Evaluation and Assessment at the Tufts University School of Medicine, and Assistant Professor in the Department of Medicine. In 2015, he accepted the position as Director of Assessment and Institutional Effectiveness at Northwestern Health Sciences University, a university aspiring to be a world-class health sciences university, that educates students, practitioners, and leaders in health and wellness solutions to help people live healthier lives. Yung-Chi is a long-term devoted educator. He has been an Adjunct Assistant Professor at UMUC since 2006, and was promoted to Adjunct Associate Professor in 2015. He is also an Associate Professor at NWHSU. He is currently developing a not-for-profit organization (YUAN3 CHIH4 EDUCATION) to promote global sharing of educational and health care resources. In his spare time he enjoys reading, writing, dreaming, dancing (recently salsa and argentine tango), and occasionally playing poker (currently no-limit Texas Hold’em).

All Women's Sound Bath in the comfort of a beautiful cozy home in Belmont. Come and soak in the sounds, vibrations, and healing energy during an intimate sound bath. Participation is limited so that you can each receive individual energetic healing through sound.

Two hour session consisting of powerful sounds, vibrations, energy and frequencies and meditation and reintegration. Journey in a safe and sacred space. Allow the sounds, frequencies, vibrations and energy move through you; melting away the stress and tension of the week. Help yourself rebalance, and relax. Sound healing, is extremely powerful and non-intrusive way to release emotional trauma and reduce physical pain. Instruments used will be Tibetan Singing Bowls, Bells, Tingshas, Hant Drum, Native American Drum, Rattles and the voice.

Energetic contribution of 30$.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket provided to ensure your comfort. Private sessions and instruction available by appointment.

Many blessings, Sarah - White Deer Song


A little about myself and my work through the voice of my clients:

Sarah Surrenders- White Deer Song- Is an Intuitive Healer who uses Sound as her main medium for healing. She is a Shamanic Practicioner, Legally Certified Spiritual Healer, Reiki Certified And Professionally Certified Sound Healer. Sarah leads retreats, workshops, Sound Healing classes, group sessions and offers private healings. Her focus is to help people come into their power, overcome challenges, releasing past emotional traumas, stress and anxiety reduction as well as soothing physical pain. Sarah has had beautiful responses to working on issues surrounding infertility, hormonal imbalance, anxiety, grief, depression and emotional traumas. Sarah travels extensively to pursue her studies, share the magic of sound as a healing tool and to recharge and continue her spiritual nomadic path in service and dedication. REVIEWS -

1.Sarah is absolutely amazing, she helped me deal with and move on from issues that had been dormant for many years. The outcome of my sessions was extremely positive and I am forever grateful that Sarah was able to guide me through my healing process with her beautiful sounds! If I could give a 10 star rating, I would. Thank you Sarah!!!! 2. Two years ago I met Sara through a mutual friend at a time I needed healing the most. During her group sessions, she taught us to meditate and calm our thoughts while she played her Himalayan bowls, tuning forks and many other shamanic healing techniques. With her guidance I found an inner calmness and some clarity. After a few sessions I decided I would go deeper into myself and asked for Sara to guide me in private sessions. What happened in these sessions has changed me and given me strength to believe and listen to my inner self all while healing some core issues I haven't dealt with, stemming from as far back as my childhood!
Sara you are an angel among angels.
I am grateful. Thank you 3. It's hard to find a true healer that is meant to help others and trust someone to heal you, but since the first practice with Sarah I felt so connected and truly amazed by results. So strong, devoted and passionate, ready to give whatever it takes to help. Thank you so much for wonderful experiences, visions, expansion and healing.. !

4. It's been over a year now and Sarah continues to help me and my family clear our paths and the results have been incredible - and now we are doing this long distance! What a blessing it has been to find this beautiful teacher and guide on our journey. When in the presence of someone whose work is their life's purpose, it can be felt and in Sarah's case, heard! Beautiful sounds creating beautiful results! Feeling lighter and more peaceful. Thank you so much. xo

5. Peace - love - calmness within you it's absolutely amazing; can't wait to see you Sarah at your next session!!

6. Wow. Get a sound healing from Sarah as soon as possible. It is really a life changing experience. We get so caught up in the world around us that we end up missing the world inside us. My experience with Sarah helped me get back in touch with my inner-world. What Sarah offers through her intuitive gifts, shamanic training, singing bowls and tuning forks is absolutely transformative. She is able to help you work through mental, emotional and physical blockages through the power of sound. I can't recommend Sarah more highly because she is the best at what she does. I've been practicing sound healing for years and Sarah is the most remarkable sound healer and teacher I've ever met. She does not just play the bowls. She invites them. Each time, depending on who she is healing, the bowls sound a different story and her intuitive power discovers what the story is and how it wants to play out. There are very few people that have this ability but what makes Sarah even more special is that she has the boundless compassion to heal with elegance and grace. I hope as many people support Sarah as possible as she is doing such an important service for all beings. She also does distant healings which are extremely effective. So, please, follow Sarah, receive a healing and be blessed in the source of beauty through which Sarah breathes, expands and heals.

results.description:
Presented in glorious Ultra Panavision 70mm, complete with an overture and intermission! Join us for this special roadshow engagement of the film during our first two weeks of shows!

Advanced Ticket prices for 70mm screenings: $16 Regular/ $13 Coolidge Members 


Set six or eight or twelve years after the Civil War, a stagecoach hurtles through the wintry Wyoming landscape. The passengers, bounty hunter John Ruth (Kurt Russell) and his fugitive Daisy Domergue (Jennifer Jason Leigh), race towards the town of Red Rock where Ruth, known in these parts as “The Hangman,” will bring Domergue to justice.

Along the road, they encounter two strangers: Major Marquis Warren (Samuel L. Jackson), a black former union soldier turned infamous bounty hunter, and Chris Mannix (Walton Goggins), a southern renegade who claims to be the town’s new Sheriff. Losing their lead on the blizzard, Ruth, Domergue, Warren and Mannix seek refuge at Minnie's Haberdashery, a stagecoach stopover on a mountain pass.

When they arrive at Minnie’s, they are greeted not by the proprietor but by four unfamiliar faces: Bob (Demian Bichir), who’s taking care of Minnie’s while she’s visiting her mother, is holed up with Oswaldo Mobray (Tim Roth), the hangman of Red Rock, cow-puncher Joe Gage (Michael Madsen), and Confederate General Sanford Smithers (Bruce Dern). As the storm overtakes the mountainside stopover, our eight travelers come to learn they may not make it to Red Rock after all...​

Ticket prices for 70mm screenings: $16 Regular/ $13 Coolidge Members (No member comps, no matinee discount, and no additional senior discount on Wednesdays for screenings on 70mm). 

See you at the 70mm movies,

John

results.description:
We'll see the 4pm Saturday showing of "Carol"  at Kendall Square. As an add on for those so inclined, we'll meet for lunch 75 minutes prior, at 2:45pm at Friendly Toast and discuss Patricia Highsmith's "The Price of Salt". It's a 270 page short novel (which if you believe the books cover, was the inspiration for Nabokov's "Lolita").  It the source material which the movie is based upon.


More on the movie : From RT. Critics Consensus: Shaped by Todd Haynes' deft direction and powered by a strong cast led by Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara, Carol lives up to its groundbreaking source material.

"Loneliness and longing are at the center of these two women's lives, at least for a while, and they're expressed by nuance and implication in a pair of superb performances, and by a lovely evocation of the period". (Joel Mortgensen, WSJ review)

After the movie, we'll go to Cambridge Brewing to discuss.

JANUARY SPECIAL - ONLY $5 .................Happy New Year!!

Tea Dances have always been a huge part of our culture, bringing the entire LGBTQ community together all under one roof! Twisted T-Dance offers you not one, but two DJ's spinning different genres all night long.

If you have not been upstairs at Murphy's, you are missing out! This dance room is a hidden jewel with their state of the art lighting and sound system!

This is a 21+ ID - with a special $5 cover

Want to get in FREE? Join our event on FB to be automatically entered, winners chosen day of event.

** No wheelchair access to get upstairs **

Share and invite your friends, spread the word, and let's take the Northshore by storm!!

Added Bonus:
After 10 pm - Murphy's resident DJ will take over the decks, so KEEP your wristbands on and dance until closing, an pay no extra cover charge!

All Twisted T-Dance events are 100% LGBTQ and friends welcomed!! WE DON'T AND WILL NEVER JUDGE!!!

Website:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1712303692316163/

So far our plans are to eat and talk, though we can do other things as well if people would like to do so. We are located near Brighton Center, in walking distance from some B, C, and D Green line stations and a few bus lines. Address and directions will be sent on Dec. 31st, and you can also feel free to write to Nancy (the host) to get the location.

results.description: In a race to be the first to host a meetup in 2016, I'm happy to announce the Post-Resolution Vegetarian Potluck on January 2nd. I figure that, by the 2nd, we will have abandoned any resolutions we made the previous day and will be ready to eat and drink like it was our last meal. Please join us and bring a vegetarian item of your choosing. In keeping with the post-resolution theme, I will have plenty of wine, beer, rum, and a bottle of Bulgarian liqueur. Furthermore, this potluck will also have a "most decadent dessert" contest. If you're interested in entering, please also bring a dessert item. I have a kitchen with all the standard stuff if you need to use anything. There is some off-street parking in my driveway and there is a parking lot on Butler Street around the corner. You can also take the red line's 'high speed' Mattapan trolley to the Butler Street stop. My place is a 2 minute walk from the stop.
results.name: Post-resolution Vegetarian Potluck

results.description: Hi all. Let's start of 2016 with a friendly meet and greet, for new members and new Boston residents. Join us for drinks, apps and recap our NYE adventures. Depending on what everyone wants to do, we can check out another place later on in the evening.
results.name: New Year, New Friends

results.description:
Why not kick off the new year of tastings with a sparkling twist?

Since you may often only order one glass of sparkling wine in a restaurant, this would be an opportunity to compare a few levels of sweetness (or "dosage") while learning about the countries that make sparkling wines. The hope would be to end up with a range of sweetness from Extra-Brut, Brut, Extra Dry, or Demi-sec, so that we can sample the differences. It will also be fun to include regions like: Champagne, Prosecco, Moscato d'Asti, Sekt, Cava, American varieties, etc. 


Details:

• Bring a bottle of sparkling wine in the $20-$40 range. If you're interested in a higher priced bottle, consider partnering with another guest to split the cost.

• Bring at least 3 glasses (preferred Champagne glass, but that's up to you).

• Bring either an appetizer or dessert to share with the small group.  Examples for pairing are:  creamy cheeses like brie or triple crème, seafood (especially sweet shellfish like scallops, and lobster and crab - the ambitious person might make a bisque) salty & greasy foods  (think potato chips, Chinese takeout fried shrimp, fried potstickers, fried mozzarella), pasta or pasta salad with a creamy sauce.
results.name: Bring in the Bubbly New Year

results.description:
Let's celebrate the new year at Frost Ice Loft and share our new year resolutions, while sipping on cocktails and wine. "FROST Ice Loft, located in Faneuil Hall, houses New England’s only permanent indoor bar designed and furnished entirely of ice. Guests can enjoy a transportive experience within the dramatic, artfully-sculpted lounge serving premium spirits, featured cocktails, local brews, wine and non-alcoholic selections."-www.frosticeloft.com.

Everyone is advised to dress warm for this occasion. Jackets/coat worn indoors. Additionally, there is a fee of $6 to rent an extra warm garment, if needed. Reservation is required. RSVP for the 7:30pm session through www.tickets.frosticeloftcom for a fee of $12. The group will meet in the lobby @7:15pm and will head on up for the 7:30pm session. When we're finished hanging at the loft, we will head to Koy restaurant for hot soup and appetizers, and maybe more...! 😊

The Frost Ice loft and Koy are a "must try" in the Faneuil hall area!
results.name: Let's meet @Frost Ice Bar--for a chill time!

results.description:
Put on your dancing shoes! You are invited to the kick-off dance to our Queer Women Dance Night Out monthly series: Let's Get This Party Started. 

Where: Sons of Italy Hall 
117 Swanton St.
Winchester, MA

When: Saturday, January 2, 2016
7:30PM to 11:00PM

Entrance:
$15 in advance, you can register and pay at http://www.meetup.com/Queer-Women-Dance-Night-Out/ until midnight January 1 or pay $18 at the door.

Free for those born in January.

Ample free parking and cash bar will be provided. 

The night will start off with a dance lesson at 7:30 pm to get you on the floor with some fun new steps. Later in the night there will be a chance to perfect your moves and participate in the fun raffle we have planned.

We are looking forward to dancing with you and celebrating the New Year with a festive night full of dancing, great music, socializing with old friends, and meeting new people.

Hope to see you there. Please spread the word.

Happy New Year!

results.description:
We'll hike 6-7 mi. keeping an eye on the look out for pirate treasure, legend says, was buried here and never found!

The trail will take us by a stone tower (closed) wolf pits dug in the 1600's to rid the area of wolves, a pirate's grave and if the weather cooperates, great views of Boston and the North Shore!

Duration: Approximately 3-3.5 hours. However, any time estimate given by an Event Organizer is just that. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the group itself. Don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day. The Organizer is not responsible for getting you back in time.

There is no way of knowing trail conditions ahead of time. Use your own judgment. Anyone with recurrent "No Shows" or about whom we have received complaints from fellow hikers will not be accepted. If you haven't hiked with us before, add yourself to the list if you can adhere to these basic prerequisites. Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. We are committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up. 

This hike is rated intermediate, You should be able to stay with the group going at a pace. of 2.5 MPH.This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy snow or extreme cold weather  cancels. Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers),  and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event.

Please remember that your Event Organizers are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below:
Remember: Your Event Organizers are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason. 

If you want to carpool, put a message in the comment section.   If someone wants to carpool, please send that person a direct message by clicking on their profile

results.description:
Meet to paint the model for a five week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $75, non-members for $90.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $75 or $90 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.
results.how_to_find_us: corner of Vernon and Central streets
results.name: Sunday painting (5 weeks!)

results.description:
This week we will connect HH to a new trail on Northfield Road.  This is approx 4 miles round trip and takes just about an hour and fifteen minutes. It is a nice hike mostly on Cart paths. We will meet at 156 S. Row Road, in Lunenburg Hike over to the trail head and make our way around the forest. Wear sturdy shoes or boots. Sneakers are OK, however we do encounter streams from time to time. Socially behaved dogs are welcome, please bring your own doggie bags.
Directions.
From the center of Lunenburg
Rte 2A East Approx 3/4 mile turn left onto Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx 1/2 mile on Townsend Harbor Road to the stop sign. Turn left at the stop sign to continue on Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx another 1/2 mile at the fork stay left onto South Row Road. Follow South Row Road for approx 1/2 mile.
My house is on the right.
Uturn Driveway, Brown house. Pull right into the driveway.

results.description:
We will be working through Meyer text on the Dussack.  We will also look at how these techniques apply to  One-handed or arming sword.

We are going to interpret Joachim Meyer’s Dussak.  The translation we will use is in

The Art of Combat: A German Martial Arts Treatise of 1570 (Hardcover)

http://www.amazon.com/gp/offer-listing/1848327781/ref=sr_1_5_twi_2_har_olp?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1434813702&sr=1-5&keywords=meyer

with additional material from Meyer’s 1560 work

https://sites.google.com/site/jochimmeyer1560/home/Meyer_1560_english_Maurer_2012.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1

From Jakob Sutor’s “New Illustrated Fechtbuch” of 1612

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bxqzt-jcOCFsT19Xa1Q2QXltWm8/edit

Finally some from

Cod.Guelf.83.4 Aug.8º


http://www.thearma.org/Manuals/Codex-Guelf-83.4-Aug-8f-translation.pdf
results.name: Dussack, One-handed sword, Interpreting Meyer Dussack

results.description:
Greater Boston Oasis meets every week for engaging speakers, live musicians, and the opportunity to connect with the community. Details of the speakers, musical guests, etc. will be posted in the individual meetups as they are confirmed.

Doors for the event open at 10:00 AM for coffee and conversation, with the program starting at 10:30. We hope to see you there!

=========================================

Oasis meets in the Teen Center at the YMCA. To find the room, enter through the lower entrance (on Dartmouth Street, by the swimming pool), and follow Oasis signs from the front lobby to the Teen Center on the second floor. (Note: the stairwell to the Teen Center is NOT the stairwell in the front lobby. That is Stairwell A. The Teen Center is located at Stairwell B, next to the Yoga Studio. Oasis volunteers will be available to help provide assistance, and signage will be posted.

=========================================

Greater Boston Oasis is a secular community dedicated to providing for the human need for social and intellectual community, for those people who may not want or be able to have those needs met in a church or other faith-based community. 

Our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs


Reality is known through reason


Meaning comes from making a difference


Human hands solve human problems


Be accepting, and be accepted

Atheist or agnostic, freethinker or skeptic, deist or theist, all those with whom those values resonate are welcome to celebrate the human experience.

results.description:
Come join us at our regular Scrabble Meetup, and play over lunch or a pastry and some coffee!

We meet twice a month, every month, on the first and third Sunday. Please bring a board if you have one. We have a few spares, so you are welcome to come even if you forget your board.

Newcomers are always welcome. We keep 2 and 3 letter "cheat sheets" for new folks to keep the playing field more even.

We mostly play Scrabble one-on-one, and pairing is random. If you would like to be matched up to someone of a similar skill, just let the organizer know.

Au Bon Pain is right next to the Davis Square T stop, and there is typically ample free street parking on Sundays.  A few times a year, there is a race in Davis Square that shuts down some streets, so keep an eye out for that. If possible I will send out a message to the group the day before.

$2/Meetup goes to help pay for the annual Meetup.com dues and miscellaneous photocopying, but if you are a regular $15/year will be easier for you and me to keep track of!

http://divineoffice.org/xmas-epiphany-dp2-current/?date=20160103

Also at half time we'll finish with Evening Prayer:

http://divineoffice.org/xmas-epiphany-ep2/?date=20160103<a href="http://divineoffice.org/holy-family-ep2/?date=20151227"></a>

The Buffalo Wings will be served right after Evening Prayer as an appetizer. If you'd rather just have those that's fine, or bring your as well. So don't worry if you cannot arrive before they are served at around 3:00 PM with other foods for those who are either vegetarian, vegan or just don't like chicken.


GO PATRIOTS!!

& if you really don't understand football, can't really figure out what's going on, we are ready with a simple one-page handout that explains the very simple rules around which the entire game evolves! Many of my foreign friends, men & women, and many American women, when getting this "Code Cracker" to football's game rules, have become avid fans of the sport and continue with much interest to watch the game many years after.

All are welcome!  FREE EVENT

Walk (just around the corner) to the Faneuil Street Entrance and Ring the Doorbell to Apartment #1. Call 781-C-FRIARS for more information.

results.description:
Happy New Year everyone! Hope everyone had a safe and awesome holiday season.  

Well, here we are down to our last game of the pitiful 2015 season with the Ravens playing the division rival Bengals tomorrow at 1 PM.  The season has been treacherous needless to say, but football only happens 4 months out of the year, and we've got an awesome Ravens bar in the heart of Boston to celebrate at, so me thinks we should make the best of it. Let's get as many of you down to Causeway as possible tomorrow to ring in the new year and toast to better football days ahead in 2016. 

Let's also thank Causeway for a great year of Ravens game watches. Their management has gone above and beyond what was expected to host us and they are eager to do it again next year and beyond. I've already had chats with them about ways to make next year even better for Boston Ravens fans : )

Finally, thank you guys for all the donations for our Toys For Tots drive. The box really filled up toward the end of the drive, in fact it completely ripped open from the weight of the toys when I was delivering it. I'll take that as mission accomplished!

Let's do this thing right tomorrow. Get yourself down to Causeway for one last horrah! The Ravens could pull off another one riding the momentum of last weeks epic upset against the Squeelers.

See you tomorrow!

results.name: Ravens vs. Bengals

results.description:
Happy New Year!

We'll start our hike from the Great Meadows National Wildlife Refuge in Sudbury.   The parking lot is next to the Refuge headquarters. We will then continue over into the Sudbury Valley Trustees property and explore there.  I plan to hike for about 2 hours, then head to Conrad's for lunch and to catch the end of the game.

*To reach the office at Weir Hill, follow Route 27 (1.7 miles) from Wayland and turn right onto Water Row Road. Follow Water Row Road (1.2 Miles) until it ends and turn right onto Lincoln Road. Travel one half mile, turn left onto Weir Hill Road. The driveway is on the right near the end of the dead-end street. 


The trails at Weir Hill take visitors  on a one-mile long walk around marshes, uplands, woodlands, fields, the river, brook, and pond. The Weir Hill trail begins in front of the refuge headquarters.  
Round Hill provides maximum reward for minimum effort. At an elevation of 227 feet, Round Hill rises only about 100 feet above the surrounding terrain but the view from the top stretches for miles, taking in river, meadows and rolling terrain, especially in winter.

Lunch will be at Conrad's - 120 Boston Post Rd, Sudbury, MA 01776


http://www.conradsrestaurant.com/sudburymenu.html


http://www.fws.gov/uploadedFiles/Region_5/NWRS/North_Zone/Eastern_Massachusetts_Complex/Great_Meadows/GRMtrails.pdf


http://www.sudburyvalleytrustees.org/sites/default/files/property/map/round_hill_interpretive_brochure.pdf


Please Read The Fine Print: 


Duration: Approximately 2 hours for the hike. However, any time estimate given is just that. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the group itself. Don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day.  I am not responsible for getting you back in time. There is no way of knowing trail conditions ahead of time. Use your own judgment. Anyone with recurrent "No Shows" or about whom we have received complaints from fellow hikers will not be accepted. Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. I am committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there, then please don't sign up.

This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy rain, snow or extreme cold weather cancels. Bring water, hiking boots or sneakers, bug spray, snacks and any personal medicines. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

No dogs are allowed on hikes. 

Please remember that I am a volunteer, the event is free, and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below:  Remember: I am a volunteer. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason.

results.description:
Our group has moved to Especially For Pets in Newton.

EFP (Especially For Pets) has a safe enclosed playroom with rubber floors, restrooms (for humans) and tons of exclusive space for our pugs to run and play.  Our new Meetup facility will NOT be charging for our use of the facility.  If you would still like to make a donation to Pug Rescue of New England (our sponsor) we will graciously accept them at the meetup but a donation is not required.

The facility is very clean and well managed and they require all pugs attending the Meetups to have veterinary proof of Rabies & Distemper vaccinations. You will not be able to participate in the Meetup without these records from your vet.  Please have your records with you for EACH Meetup.

Free Parking is available in the Business lot next to the EFP's parking lot. 

Especially For Pets will also be offering our attendees a 10% of coupon to use in their store on the day of the Meetup!

EFP has been a GREAT supporter of PRoNE over the years and we are so grateful and excited to be moving our Meetup to their facility.

Check out our new home!  http://www.especiallyforpets.com/about.html


Thanks everyone and we look forward to seeing you!!

results.description:
The new year is almost upon us - it is hard to believe that it's already 2016!

I hope that everyone is having a wonderful Christmas/Holiday season, and that the knitted gifts turned out just right. Mine did I'm happy to say:-)

I wish all my knitting friends and their families a peaceful, healthy, and prosperous year and look forward to continuing our knitting meetings throughout the next year and beyond.

Speaking of which, it is almost time for our next meet up - I'm open for business on Sunday, January 3rd at 3 pm, so please sign up as soon as possible just so I know how many people are planning on coming.

My regulars already know this, but for any new members -my house is almost at the fork where Franklin Street joins Nahant Street. It's a blue duplex with a porch in the front and the American flag hanging over it. Please keep in mind that I share my driveway with my neighbor, so parking in the driveway is limited. I'll put my car in the garage, and my husband plans to make himself scarce for "my" Sunday afternoons, so there should be a couple of parking spaces in the driveway; but please park as far to the side as you can, so my neighbor can get in and out. There is parking on one side of my street, and on the surrounding streets, so you should not have any problems finding a spot. I have scheduled several meetings automatically, every two weeks, on Sundays, 3 to 5 pm. If I have to cancel a meet up for any reason (family matters and such), I will let everyone know at least a few days in advance.
results.name: Meet up for our crafts again

results.description:
Our first chess meetup in the new year! Let's meet at Panera at 3 o'clock--I will bring one nicer set/board and one dinky plastic one, feel free to bring your own!

James
Organizer
results.name: *Second* Ever Waltham Casual Chess Players Meetup

results.description:
From the Official Procrastinator's Department comes this - a visit on the last day to see the Theo Jansen's Strandbeests -


PEM presents the first major American exhibition of Theo Jansen's famed kinetic sculptures. Dynamic and interdisciplinary, Jansen's Strandbeests ("beach animals") blur the lines between art and science, sculpture and performance. The exhibition celebrates the thrill of the Strandbeests' unique locomotion as well as the processes that have driven their evolutionary development on the Dutch seacoast. The kinetic sculptures are accompanied by artist sketches, facilitated demonstrations of the creatures' complex ambulatory systems, a hall of "fossils" as well as photography by Lena Herzog.

(More info at link: http://pem.org/sites/strandbeest/the_exhibition/)


We'll meet at 3:00 inside the museum atrium at the bottom of the main stairs. (Give or take a few minutes.)

NOTE: This is so last minute, I'm not sure it will be a go. Check for RSVPs before you head out. (The host is almost positive he's going, but may not if there aren't any RSVPs.)


RSVP: "If possible" by 1:45 Sunday (If we have at least two people and you decide to come without RSVPing, please feel free to just show up.)

Meeting Place: 3:00 inside the museum, at the foot of the main stairs in the atrium (+ or - a few minutes).


Dinner or a bite to eat afterwards? Maybe - if there's interest!

Host: Chris (guy in picture). My cell number is[masked]-6077.
results.how_to_find_us: In Museum Atrium at foot of main stairs
results.name: An Impromptu visit to the Strandbeests (at PEM Salem)

venue.address_1: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138
venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
Join the oldest established permanent floating Community Walk in Cambridge and Environs.  Join the Community Walkers and walkers from five other meetup groups.   Let's join 20+ others from six other walking groups for:

Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 1/3 3:30

results.description:
“Last time was a blast, so let's do it again. I can offer to host monthly meetups in my house in Belmont on weekends.”

Each musician attending, please suggest 3 tunes in advance. This way others will have a chance to look at your tunes in advance and prepare. We will first go through the tunes each one suggests in advance, then do others....

We will start at about 3:30 and end by 7PM.

Also, each member who attends has to pay $12 per person per calendar year to cover the $144 per year cost to maintain the Jazz Jamming group on the Meetup website. Since the beginning of 2015, we collect the $12 online. This is a one-time payment per calendar year. Thanks very much.

results.description:
Join the Fresh Pond Walking Community for our regular Sunday walk around Fresh Pond.   

Let's join regular walkers from surrounding towns + members of five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.

If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 1/3 3:30

results.description:
Let's start to talk about a custom tour we could do together.  Italy is a big country, so I have listed a few possibilities for starters, but am certainly open to others:


- Northern Italy - Venice, Milan, Lake Como

- Tuscany - Florence, Siena, other hill towns

- Rome and Umbria

- Naples and the Amalfi Coast

- Puglia

- Sicily

Even if you can't join us at the next Meetup, send me your thoughts and we'll see if we can design something.
results.name: Conversation and Socializing about Italy

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Panera Bread in Porter Square Shopping Center

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Panera Bread is right next to Dunkin Donuts. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 35-45 -- SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

venue.name: ONLINE

results.description:
I have shamelessly stolen the photo challenges from Dale Foshe's[masked]-Week Challenge to create our own on-line photo opportunity! Since I didn't get this posted before the new year, for the initial challenge I will sign everyone up to participate. Future challenges will require people to RSVP to participate and will be posted soon.

SUBJECTS 01-04 -
01. Portrait: Self Portrait - Take a "selfie"! Explore the self timer, remote shutter, or your phones camera!
02. Landscape: Traditional Landscape - Shoot a beautiful landscape. Find a nice foreground and don't forget the sky.
03. Artistic: Red- Red should be the focus of the image. Don't be afraid to be creative.Shoot whatever inspires you.
04. Portrait: Headshot - Spotlight someone of important in your life

*** Upload a max of 1 to 2 images per subject.
*** Please try to title your work.
*** Please make constructive, appreciative comments on a minimum of 2 other images for every image you post.
*** 1 image from your library can be shared per subject, but the object is to take new images.

If anyone has suggestions or an on-line source that would be helpful to a specific subject, please share in the comments for the challenge.

Looking forward to seeing what we will share and learn from each other over the coming year!
results.name: 2016 Photo Challenge - WKS 01-04

results.description:
Welcome in the new year with a beautiful contra dance, Sunday January 3rd, at 1950 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge MA.

Caller: Dugan Murphy
Music: Jonah Sidman, Glen Loper, Jonathan Cannon

Dance 7:30-10:30pm
Dessert Potluck during the break -- Bring something to share! **Please feel free to join us at 7:00 for a beginner's lesson if you're fresh to contra dancing! $5-12 sliding scale, as you're able. Bring someone new to Contra to the intro session and you both get passes for free admission to a future dance! Share the love. Public Transportation (recommended): We are across the street from the Porter Square Red Line stop.

Parking: Free street parking (meters and residential are open to all on Sundays). Don't park in the Shaw's parking lot because they tow.

See you there!

What a wonderful way to welcome in the New Year!! Happy 2016!

Welcome in the New Year right with with the first Zouk / Kizomba party at Wonder Bar in Allston!! Our first kick off event will feature traditional Brazilian Zouk and Kizomba jams along with more hip-hop oriented flavors!

Come at 7pm for a lesson from Moves & Vibes dance studios, no partner or experience required! We'll help you get the moves you need to get started! Dj Jem and Dj Tao Bom will be dropping 50/50 Kiz and Zouk all night so you'll be able to dance your favorite styles non-stop!

We'll have some awesome performances for you and looking for more dancers wanting to share their Zouk / Kiz/ or Hip-Hop skillz!

Invite to all your dancer friends. Let's make 2016 huge for Zouk and Kizomba!!

21+

$10 Class and Party

$5 Party all night

Dancing till 1:30!!

Please RSVP here!
